paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the BRCA2 gene with detailed penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Poland and the Czech Republic also show a high frequency of BRCA2 c.658_659del (p.Val220Ilefs*4) variant (6% and 3%, respectively; Supplementary Table S1; [70]).
Poland and the Czech Republic also show a high frequency of BRCA2 c.658_659del (p.Val220Ilefs*4) variant (6% and 3%, respectively; Supplementary Table S1; [70]).

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a significant risk of hereditary breast-ovarian cancer.

variants.additional_notes: This variant is one of the more common BRCA2 mutations in Slavic populations.
key_quotes: Poland and the Czech Republic also show a high frequency of BRCA2 c.658_659del (p.Val220Ilefs*4) variant.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: BRCA2 c.5286T>G (p.Tyr1762*) is a Northern Russian founder variant accounting for half of BRCA2 pathogenic alleles in hereditary breast-ovarian cancer patients from the Arkhangelsk region.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to a premature stop codon, resulting in a truncated protein.

variants.population_frequency: Half of BRCA2 pathogenic alleles in Arkhangelsk region
variants.additional_notes: This variant is significant in the Northern Russian population.
key_quotes: BRCA2 c.5286T>G (p.Tyr1762*) is a Northern Russian founder variant accounting for half of BRCA2 pathogenic alleles in hereditary breast-ovarian cancer patients from the Arkhangelsk region.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
